page.title: 10THRIFT FARM
page.content: Thrift Farm is an establishment for severely educationally subnormal people. In the main they come from Queen's school in Bletchley. It is the only one of its kind in the country. The farm is not run to make a profit but by selling its produce it does manage to break even. There are 52 acres of land. A range of animals are kept including 25 cattle, 60 sheep, 200 chickens, producing roughly 160 eggs per day, a donkey and some goats. A variety of crops are grown and sold. They include bedding plants, herbaceous plants and vegetable plants.
